pros: Great coworker, plenty of help with resources and communication.
cons: Scheduling can be difficult, especially if you are are a student, as well.

job_title: Director of Alumni Affairs in Cresson, PA
pros: Mount Aloysius is fortunate to have strong leadership from the President and Vice Presidents. They are forward-thinking, responsive to staff concerns and requests, and have open door policies so your voice can be heard. The College also has a strong mission built on the history of the Religious Sisters of Mercy. Everyone buys into the mission of the College and wants to support students any way they can to see their success.
cons: No major concerns outside of the general higher ed industrywide concerns: demographic drop off, college being a worthwhile investment, etc. But I think the Mount does a good job combating a lot of those concerns. For example, they have build partnerships with local major employers where guaranteed employment awaits graduates of certain programs. That has boosted enrollment and will help the long-term success of the College. The College is also very affordable compared to other small, liberal arts colleges and they offer a plethora of scholarships.
There was a lack of diversity

job_title: Director of Alumni Affairs in Cresson, PA
pros: The college is a small, private liberal arts institution, which provides a nice homey feel. Staff are very friendly, and leadership has been fantastic. End of year bonuses, extra wellness days off, productive open forums, etc. Everyone seems to buy into the mission, which is great. Work-life balance is fantastic (and rare these days).
cons: Because of the smaller size, pay isn't amazing, although I think it is typical for the industry.

pros: Mount Aloysius is a fantastic place to work especially if you are looking to be apart of a family. Everyone here is very friendly and courteous and will be there for you always
cons: Sometimes you might be prone to take on too much because you want to help wherever you can

review_title: No increase in pay or opportunity to advance
cons: No room for advancement because they want to save money instead of providing stable full time teachers. No increase in pay for part time adjuncts in 3 years+

pros: Beautiful campus. Nice students. Most colleagues are decent
cons: Low salary, long working hours, lack of collegiality
